topic_metadata.title: How can I get different headers per chapter?

posts.name: Olaf
posts.cooked: I would like to have a text line in the header of the pages that is different for each chapter. The first page of a chapter should not have a header.
posts.raw: I would like to have a text line in the header of the pages that is different for each chapter. The first page of a chapter should not have a header.

posts.name: SillyFreak
posts.cooked:
What you want is probably this package:

Typst

hydra – Typst Universe

Query and display headings in your documents and templates.
posts.raw:
What you want is probably this package:

https://typst.app/universe/package/hydra/

posts.name: Olaf
posts.cooked:
Interesting package! I’ll keep that in mind. Thank you.

But it doesn’t provide the functionality I want. The line of text I want to display in the header area should be independent of the header.
posts.raw:
Interesting package! I'll keep that in mind. Thank you.

But it doesn't provide the functionality I want. The line of text I want to display in the header area should be independent of the header.

posts.name: Olaf
posts.cooked:
I have found out. It’s much easier than I thought:

= Chap 1

#set page(header: [Some text in the heder of Chap 1])

#lorem(30)

= Chap 2

#set page(header: [Some text in the heder of Chap 2])

#lorem(30)

= Chap 3

#set page(header: none)

#lorem(30)
posts.raw:
I have found out. It's much easier than I thought:

```typ
= Chap 1

#set page(header: [Some text in the heder of Chap 1])

#lorem(30)

= Chap 2

#set page(header: [Some text in the heder of Chap 2])

#lorem(30)

= Chap 3

#set page(header: none)

#lorem(30)
```
